version_description:
Grab your seat because this update will rock you on so many levels:
- 4 new languages: Arabic and Hebrew is out of beta now and we top that with a brand new Danish and Hungarian! (more to come, ha!)
- introducing Tough Word Dojo: a dedicated gym for those tough words that haunts you (available for premium users)
- Drops' eye candy design just go even more polished with buttery smooth transitions, subtle animations, a brand new session summary screen. 
I don't tell you more, go and discover the rest of the goodies yourself! :) (oh, and don't forget to let us know what you loved/would improve - email us at sup@languagedrops.com , we are stoked to hear your thoughts! )

Kial ĝirafo neniam estas sola?
Ĉar ĝi ĉiam havas kolegon!
... Don't get it?

No wonder why: it's in the most popular dead language: Esperanto!
Wait... can something be dead that never really lived?
All the mysteries waiting for you in our brand new Esperanto course!

Ohh and we also added Swedish & Norwegian.
Ingen orsak!

Also... Please say goodbye to some of your (least) favourite bugs! Let them never return.

We can’t and won’t stop: two new languages in the bag! Please welcome Turkish and Vietnamese among the available languages in Drops! 
Which languages are next? Time will tell. Which languages SHOULD come next? You should tell us in the reviews! ;)

If you're a subscriber, we have big news for you:
By popular demand, you can now enjoy the thrill of the time-limited sessions - with unlimited restarts! You can also go back to unlimited session length if you want (just open the Profile tab).
We hope this will add to your premium experience! If the answer is yes / no : let us know at sup@languagedrops.com!

On the other hand... want to guess what languages are coming to Drops soon?

You can now add Tagalog also known as Filipino to your list of languages to learn.
As the only Spanish-inspired language in Asia, the Tagalog vocabulary is rich in thousands of Spanish loanwords. With its country named Philippines in honor of King Philip II of Spain, you’ll easily understand why the Filipino/Tagalog language is deeply rooted in Spanish heritage. Another exciting part about this language is the mixed influence of Malay and Chinese.
Tara! Laro ka na ng Drops! :)

Drops just turned 3 and we celebrate this anniversary with a blast:
- A new handsome icon!
- Apple Watch app: we couldn’t find a decent watch app for learning languages so we made one
- Select your language path: choose WHY you learn the language and we automagically serve the new topics based on your selection!
- Tagalog (Filipino) & Hindi language !
- and a few more tasty surprises which are… well, surprises ;)

Fear not - we’ve grown up but the joy seeking attitude remained!

The show goes on: 2 brand new languages! Welcome Indonesian and Dutch! Our back-to-school discount is live for a few more day too!
Our Japanese offering is boosted with dedicated Katakana topic, the Chinese now teaches the 100 most fundamental radicals and Hindi also got it’s well deserved alphabet topic!
+ various other tidbits:
- Apple Watch app also got some new powers
- fixed ton of old dusty bugs :)

Not yet released but we have some crazy exciting AR stuff baking in our kitchen and we are working on a special way to teach Chinese, Japanese, Korean, Arabic and Hebrew characters - in signature Drops-style of course! Keep tuned, the next month will be HUGE!

-Also, you can now use google for synching your app progress

Do you like things in order? Pretty and neat? We do, too! That's why we reorganized the topic screen for you. We made it easier to navigate through the list of topics and choose what you want to learn! Enjoy
